Articles.Content:
Keridian Dynamics (KDVA)

Parts pack for resource-conversion and vessel-assembly for Kerbal Space Program.

By zer0Kerbal, originally by @Eleusis La Arwall

adopted with express permission and brought to you by KerbSimpleCo

PECUNIA PER KERBULUS

Preamble by @Eleusis La Arwall

This pack contains a Furnace and a ChemicalReactor to convert Ore to Metal and a 3D-Printer to print RocketParts from Metal. Also some launchpads that require ExtraplanetaryLaunchpads to assemble vessels from Rocketparts and some tanks to store Metal and RocketParts. The production-chain is very basic: Ore --> Metal --> RocketParts --> Vessel.

See More

  • See our Parts Catalog for part pictures
  • For more images, see our Marketing Slicks
  • Discussions and news on this mod: See Discussions or KSP Forums
  • Changelog Summary for more details of changes : See ChangeLog
  • Known Issues for more details of feature requests and known issues : See Known Issues
  • GitHub Pages : See Pages

Help Wanted

  • Compatibility patches
  • Contracts for these glorious parts!
  • Variant Textures
  • Model updates to Unity 2019
  • Marketing Images and Videos such as hero shots, animated gifs, short highlight
  • Have a request? Glad to have them, kindly submit through GitHub.

Localization

  •  English
  •  Simplified Chinese (简体中文) 太感谢了 (thank you) to @ShadowSTAR616
  •  Taiwanese (国语) 太感谢了 (thank you) to @ShadowSTAR616
  • your translation here

HELP WANTED - See the README in the Localization folder or the Quickstart Guide for instructions for adding or improving translations. GitHub push is the best way to contribute. Additions and corrections welcome!

  •  English
  • your translation here

HELP WANTED - See the README in the Localization folder or the Quickstart Guide for instructions for adding or improving translations. GitHub push is the best way to contribute. Additions and corrections welcome!

Installation Directions 1

Use CurseForge/OverWolf App (currently does not install dependencies)

Whilst I agree CKAN is a great mod for those that can't use zip tools. I take no part, nor am I interested in maintaining the CKAN mod metadata for my mods. Please don't ask me about it but refer to the CKAN mod thread if you are having issues with CKAN or the metadata it maintains. Beware, CKAN can really mess up though it tries very, very, very hard not to.

or 

Dependencies

  • Kerbal Space Program  2

Recommends

  • Either
    • Extraplanetary Launchpads (XPL) or SimpleConstruction! (SCON)
      • One of the XPL based construction addons are 99.9% required
      • KSP will load all parts but some will have reduced or no function
      • The configs autodetects if XPL or SCON are installed and uses the corresponding modules
  • Module Manager or Module Manager /L3
    • Resource Switchers Supported: Interstellar Fuel Switch CORE, Firespitter CORE, and B9PartSwitch
    • One of the Resource Switcher addons are 99% required
    • KSP will load all parts but some will have reduced or no function
    • The configs autodetects if Interstellar Fuel Switch CORE, Firespitter CORE or B9PartSwitch is installed and uses the corresponding modules
    • If multiple ResourceSwitchers are installed, the priority goes as follows: Interstellar Fuel Switch CORE > [Firespitter][fs] > B9PartSwitch

Suggests

  • GPO (Goo Pumps & Oils') Speed Pump (GPO)
  • Not So SimpleConstructon! (NSSC)
  • On Demand Fuel Cells (ODFC)
  • SimpleLogistics! (SLOG)
  • Transparent Command Pods (TP)
  • GTIndustries
  • JSI Advanced Transparent Pods- gives the passable and nonpassable Storage Tanks an IVA overlay
  • Kerbal Inventory System - this gives the Launchsite and Sledgehammer function
  • Kerbal Attachment System - allows the RecycleSite to dump all recycled resources
  • PatchManager - allows patches to be easily toggleable
  • TweakScale

Supports

  • Resource Switchers
    • Interstellar Fuel Switch CORE
    • Firespitter CORE
    • B9PartSwitch
  • Community Tech Tree
  • Community Resource Pack
  • Connected Living Space
  • Contract Configurator
  • FAR
  • Firespitter for fully functioning wheels. may invoke bouts of dizziness.
  • GTIndustries
  • JSI Advanced Transparent Pods- gives the passable and nonpassable Storage Tanks an IVA overlay
  • Kerbal Inventory System - this gives the Launchsite and Sledgehammer function
  • Kerbal Attachment System - allows the RecycleSite to dump all recycled resources
  • On Demand Fuel Cells (ODFC)
  • OSE Workshop
  • PatchManager - allows patches to be easily toggleable
  • ReStock
  • TweakScale

Replaces

  • KeridianDynamicsVesselAssembly

Tags

  • parts, config, flags, agency, resources, science, tech-tree, career, crewed, uncrewed

Edited June 9, 2021 by zer0Kerbal
This mod is a godsend, most useful thing I've installed in ages!
Finally an alternative to the default EL smelters, those don't look very uh... good..., unlike these ones!

Gonna try this out. Will report back tomorrow.

EDIT: Alright, right off the bat I see all the KD stuff doesn't have it's own dedicated category type in the VAB/SPH like all EL stuff does. It also doesn't have a 'manufacturer' either to be able to group them that way (well, it does have a manufacturer, but it doesn't show up as a particular tab in Advanced Mode). I'll use Janitor's Closet to filter accordingly for now.
I'm really liking the fact that KD uses SystemHeat (or is that automatic module handling?), and that the normal drills got a metalore function. Kinda wish the furnaces still used the EL method of turning metalore+LF+Ox to metal, instead of turning ore to metal (the chemical reaction made sense) but that's not a huge issue. Well, not much of an issue at all since I didn't like the fact that you needed Kethane to have hotspots of metalore on worlds. Simple is not always better but that felt like a roundabout way of cheating me out of good metalore extraction since Kethane is a no-go right now.
I thought for a moment I was missing the recyclers, but they're just in a science node that was empty beforehand (thus still locked). Pretty late in the CTT, as it were. Don't actually know how tech tree integration works, but I would have liked to unlock the smaller recycler earlier, and the big one later.

Models are, at the very least, at the level of stock parts. The only part I would say could use some work is the KD-OrbitalHangar. I understand what it's going for, but if I were to use anything with a gantry I'd probably make my own with robotics so as to fold everything neatly. As it is, too unwieldy.

P.S. As it were, some testing also answered the question I had yesterday on the EL thread, namely that the recycler (at least the EL one) will correctly transfer the 'rocket part' resource to available storage space. This mean that I can launch RP payloads from the surface of the Mun using solid rocket boosters (plus a bit of LF/Ox for adjustment), and have the orbital shipyard eat everything whole instead of having to worry about docking, or even having crew on hand.

P.P.S. Well, recyclers also eat Kerbals. Good to know. It seems they are worth some scrap metal too (10.62 to be exact). It's a morbid idea, but you could build a craft out of little green men.

Edited November 24, 2021 by Axelord FTW

On 11/24/2021 at 4:50 AM, Axelord FTW said:

recyclers also eat Kerbals

we are sending the recyclers back to primary school to discern the difference between scrap and kerbals;  although in the recycler's defense, they do kinda resembler each other.  (In truth, I don't believe there is anything that can be done about the blood-thirst all recyclers seem to have.

Oh no, I'm not complaining about that at all! The more Kerbal-eating machinery that can be found in-game, the better.

EDIT: I'm having trouble with the KD-3D Printer. Lets me start and stop the RP printing in the VAB, but in-flight all I get as options are Toggle, Deploy, and Retract. Clicking on the last two just removes them from the list of options, and does nothing. Going by that and also what my code-illiterate brain can see by what's in the .cfg, I'm guessing this part is supposed to have an animation, and that only the 'deployed' version of the part can make RP out of metal in-flight. Initially, I get 'Status: locked' on launch but hitting Deploy or Retract adds another that says 'Status: Moving'.

If I switch away to another scene or vessel and come back (before touching anything), I get the option to start printing RP, but hitting Deploy or Retract will stop the process and lock things up permanently. The printer has a duplicate .cfg entry (well, it's almost completely identical) in the parts folder. Don't think this has anything to do with it.

EDIT2: For now I deleted the animation modules in the .cfg, and also removed one of the duplicates. Seems to work, I can start and stop at will, and there are no more jank buttons.

Edited November 27, 2021 by Axelord FTW

11 hours ago, Axelord FTW said:

trouble

would you kindly submit an issue on the GitHub Repo?

https://github.com/zer0Kerbal/KeridianDynamics/issues

Don't want to submit anything half-assed, and I don't have a clean KSP install anywhere to test specific mods on at the moment. I'll see what I can do tomorrow.

EDIT: Sorry, but I'm having HDD issues and I'm low on SSD space. I might get it sorted out later, or not. I'm kinda lazy.
P.S. Also spotted the chemical reactor has one of its outputs set as [EC+MetalOre=>Metal+Ore] (instead of the listed Metal+LFO output). Either the text on the button/description are wrong, or the output. The .cfg file for the reactor 

The [EC+Ore=>Metal+LF+Ox] works as advertised, and I haven't seen any other discrepancies yet.

KD-Recycler Site also shows as having a volume of 555,000 liters, making it impossible to put into a container, or into a Kerbal's inventory. Also, not that I actually want to do this, but large KD recycler has a similar volume (460k L), so I'm thinking this is related in the way KIS tries to calculate the volume (which would include the recycling area)? I'll add the following to the part's .cfg in the meantime.  Doesn't seem to fix anything, my ctrl+c/ctrl+v skills have been thwarted! 

KD-Extension Pad also doesn't seem to generate whatever you want to build on it correctly. At least, it doesn't generate a functional orientation, if you want to compare it to any other 'launchpads'). Generated crafts to be built over the KD-EP are flipped 180 degree (an horizontal KD-EP pointing east, for example, will generate whatever pointing west instead), and also offset in such a way that the generated extension will stick out in both directions from the KD-EP's main axis. 

EDIT3?: Also changed the attachment rules for the recycler site, to allow me to build something with a KD-RS attached to a surface. Also, I'm guessing the KD-RS should allow a hose to connect directly to it, except I wasn't getting an option, so I also had to change the attachment rule to allow other things to attach to it and slap on a KAS hose connector on the stake.

Edited November 28, 2021 by Axelord FTW

Working on Keridian Dynamics 

Track progress: issues here - projects here.

 

The Short List

@zer0Kerbal 

Edited February 25, 2022 by zer0Kerbal

Taking 'Suzie' the sledgehammer out for a testdrive.

Had Keridan Dynamics (KDVA), SimpleConstruction! (SCON) and Not So SimpleConstruction (NSSC), along with both KIS and KAS installed.

Was able to drive stakes with both stock and KAS/KIS mechanics.

Just remember if you want to use KIS/KAS (until new versions out of beta) must have the stakes in KAS inventory, not stock inventory (or use the spawn item cheat)

@taniwhaand @IgorZ

 

\

Also note:

There will be a series of updates to this addon.

Each update will update some of the parts and patches so that instead of one massive update, I can update the addon in a more manageable way.

First update coming up now.

Edited July 6, 2022 by zer0Kerbal

Version 0.8.99.0-prerelease - <Please Read the Instructions #1> edition

04 Jul 2022
Release for Kerbal Space Program [KSP 1.12.x]

DO A CLEAN INSTALL:
DELETE EXISTING INSTALLATION THEN RE-INSTALL

Download from CurseForge

Changes

This is the first in a series of updates to this addon. Each update will update some of the parts and patches so that instead of one massive update, I can update the addon in a more manageable way.

 

Spoiler

    • [KDChemicalReactor]
    • [KD3DPrinter-250.cfg]
    • [KD-SledgeHammer.cfg]
    • Cargo Tanks

      • [KD-ST1251FS]
      • [KD-ST1252FS]
      • [KD-ST1253FS]

minor changes

  • [SimpleConstruction.cfg] v v1.1.0.0
    • add header
    • remove ! hitchhiker
      • was
        • @MODULE[ModuleResourceConverter],*:HAS[!#ConverterName[Ore-->Metal+LFO]]
      • now
        • @MODULE[ModuleResourceConverter],*:HAS[#ConverterName[Ore-->Metal+LFO]]
  • [KD-OSERocketParts.cfg] v1.1.0.0
    • PatchManager\PluginData
    • add header
    • was
      • @OSE_DefaultRecipe:AFTER[Workshop]
    • now
      • @OSE_DefaultRecipe:NEEDS[Workshop]:AFTER[Workshop]
    • was
      • @PART[*]:HAS[OSE_PartRecipe:HAS[#MaterialKits[1]]]:AFTER[Workshop]
    • now
      • @PART[*]:HAS[@OSE_PartRecipe:HAS[#MaterialKits[1]]]:NEEDS[Workshop]:AFTER[Workshop]+

Compatibility

  • [KerbalInventorySystem.cfg] v1.1.0.0
    • rename from [KIS.cfg]
    • remove Sledgehammer patches
    • no longer necessary

Parts

    • [KD-3D-Printer.cfg] Original
    • new part name is: KD-3DPrinter-250
  • [ghostparts.cfg]
    • which will go away with version 0.9.0.0-release
      • KD-3D-Printer
      • KD-3DPrinter
  • Update/Lint/Asset pass
    • [KD-ST1001FS] v1.1.0.0
    • [KD-ST1251FS] v1.1.0.0
    • [KD-ST1252FS] v1.1.0.0
    • [KD-ST1253FS] v1.1.0.0
    • [KD-SledgeHammer.cfg] v1.1.0.0

    • closes #6 - [Bug ]: Also survey stakes are upside down when placed,

Graphical changes

IVA/Spaces

  • renamed from _ to - in IVA names

Localization

Version 0.8.99.1-prerelease - <#2 Please Read the Instructions> edition

17 Jul 2022
Release for Kerbal Space Program [KSP 1.12.x]

DO A CLEAN INSTALL:
DELETE EXISTING INSTALLATION THEN RE-INSTALL

Download from CurseForge

Summary

  • All Cargo Tanks are now finished with the initial pass.
  • RecycleSite had a pass.
  • All thumbs should now be available.
  • Can now search for 'kdva' in the editor search bar to find all Keridian Dynamics parts.

Changes

 

Spoiler

This is the second in a series of updates to this addon. Each update will update some of the parts and patches so that instead of one massive update I can update the addon in a more manageable way.

Part of the complexity is the advanced design of this addon. The addon is designed to be as modular as possible, so that it can be used in a variety of ways.

Summary

  • More parts updated
  • Parts Catalog now has images
  • Can now search for kd or kdva in the editor search bar to find all Keridian Dynamics parts.

Changes

This is the next in a series of updates to this addon. Each update will update some of the parts and patches so that instead of one massive update I can update the addon in a more manageable way.

Part of the complexity is the advanced design of this addon. The addon is designed to be as modular as possible, so that it can be used in a variety of ways.

11 hours ago, zer0Kerbal said:

Version 0.8.99.4-prerelease

Hi!  Thanks for updating and adding in such an awesome, sweet addition

You'll need  a hotfix though.  The OASIS isn't turning up?  I'm looking at this issue now.

It may be that the OASIS habitation part says this:

PART:NEEDS[SIMPLEXColonies]

but it "needs" to say this?

PART:NEEDS[AngleCanMods/SIMPLEXColonies]

EDIT - Nope, there may also be the model is looking in the wrong  place too.   Not sure why its not coming up.  Still looking for the problem

Edited November 10, 2022 by theJesuit

1 hour ago, theJesuit said:

Hi!  Thanks for updating and adding in such an awesome, sweet addition

You'll need  a hotfix though.  The OASIS isn't turning up?  I'm looking at this issue now.

It may be that the OASIS habitation part says this:

PART:NEEDS[SIMPLEXColonies]

but it "needs" to say this?

Welcome - still a pre-release, and wanted to get the beta in of the SIMPLEXColonies part.

I added the :NEEDS so it doesn't show up for anyone not looking - this way it is included for you to work on.  Eventually I plan on moving all the assets and configs into `Compatibility/SIMPLEX/`
